Robert Randolph "Randy" Neugebauer (born December 24, 1949) is an American politician. He was the U.S. Representative for, having served from 2003 to 2017. He is a member of the Republican Party.
According to a 2011 survey by the "National Journal", Neugebauer was "the most conservative" member of the House.
On September 17, 2015, Neugebauer announced he would not seek reelection to an eighth term in the 2016 elections.
As of April 2018, Neugebauer was the only person under consideration to head the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau in Trump Administration.
